subtopics.title: Definition
subtopics.description: Social and political conflict in France that began in 1789, pitting privileged groups against the underprivileged.

subtopics.title: Significance
subtopics.description: Beginning of the end of the old regime in Europe.

subtopics.title: Reasons for Importance
subtopics.description: Why the French Revolution was more important than its contemporaries.

children.title: Location
children.description: Happened in France, the largest, most powerful, and most populous state in Europe.

children.title: Social Revolution
children.description: Involved various groups (women, sans-culottes, peasants, bourgeoisie) with a shared goal of freedom or death.

children.title: Radicalism
children.description: Included executions of the royal family and 50,000 people.

children.title: Universality
children.description: Ideas spread throughout Europe, America, and Asia.

children.title: Conflict Representation
children.description: Conflict between the old regime and the new social order was more exact, representative, and sharp in France.

subtopics.title: Classic Stages
subtopics.description: The main periods of the French Revolution.

children.title: Constitutional Monarchy
children.description: A period of transition with a limited monarchy.

children.title: First French Republic
children.description: Establishment of a republic after the monarchy's fall.

children.title: Napoleonic Stage
children.description: The era of Napoleon Bonaparte's rule.
